messages.content:
You are a Gmail data generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to generate realistic email thread data based on scenario information.

The output must be valid JSON matching the Gmail schema with:
- threads: array of {id, subject, messages[]}
  - messages: array of {id, from, to[], subject, body, date}

Generate email threads that reflect:
- Events from sub_scenarios_expanded (core scenario events)
- Events from noise_scenarios (unrelated workplace activity)
- Respect noise_level: 0 = minimal noise, 1 = lots of unrelated emails
- Respect depth: 0 = direct/obvious emails, 1 = indirect/multi-step conversations

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:
{
  "threads": [
    {
      "id": "thread_mob_planning_invite_1",
      "subject": "Invite: MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive (scope, risks, dependencies)",
      "messages": [
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_planning_invite_initial",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [
            "jordan.johnson@company.com",
            "sam.williams@company.com",
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Invite: MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive (scope, risks, dependencies)",
          "body": "Hi all,

Following up on the Slack pings from earlier today about getting a deeper planning session on the calendar before the upcoming Planning milestone for the Mobile App Launch.

I‚Äôve gone through everyone‚Äôs availability and it looks like we can land on a 45-minute block that avoids Jordan‚Äôs ceremonies and Sam‚Äôs interviews while still being within our usual working hours.

Proposed time: Tue, Nov 11, 2025, 3:45‚Äì4:30pm ET
Location: Zoom (link in the calendar invite)
Attendees: Alex (PM), Jordan (Eng), Sam (R&D), Taylor (Eng Lead)

Focus for the session:
- Align on scope for the initial Mobile App Launch slice
- Call out major risks and technical constraints
- Confirm dependencies, owners, and any cross-team asks

I‚Äôve attached MOB-100 and MOB-101 in the calendar description as reference; please skim those ahead of time so we can use the meeting to make decisions rather than just review.

If this time creates any conflicts that I may have missed, let me know and we can adjust before end of day.

Thanks,
Alex
PM, Mobile App Launch",
          "date": "2025-11-03T12:06:02-05:00"
        },
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_planning_invite_jordan_accept",
          "from": "jordan.johnson@company.com",
          "to": [
            "alex.smith@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Re: Invite: MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive (scope, risks, dependencies)",
          "body": "Alex,

This time works for me and avoids my Mon/Wed afternoon blocks. I‚Äôve accepted the calendar invite.

I‚Äôll review MOB-100 and MOB-101 beforehand and bring notes on the current implementation risks and any dependencies on the backend services team.

Thanks for pulling this together.

Jordan",
          "date": "2025-11-03T12:14:39-05:00"
        },
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_planning_invite_sam_accept",
          "from": "sam.williams@company.com",
          "to": [
            "alex.smith@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Re: Invite: MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive (scope, risks, dependencies)",
          "body": "Hey Alex,

Thanks for coordinating. The Tuesday 3:45‚Äì4:30pm ET slot looks good on my end and doesn‚Äôt conflict with my 1:1 or Thursday interviews, so I‚Äôve accepted the invite.

I‚Äôll come prepared with:
- A quick summary of the recent perf work and any remaining technical risk areas
- A first pass at what we can realistically commit to for the initial launch slice

If there‚Äôs anything specific you‚Äôd like me to emphasize (e.g., tradeoffs between perf and feature scope), let me know ahead of time.

Sam",
          "date": "2025-11-03T12:19:03-05:00"
        },
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_planning_invite_taylor_accept",
          "from": "taylor.brown@company.com",
          "to": [
            "alex.smith@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Re: Invite: MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive (scope, risks, dependencies)",
          "body": "Alex,

Hold looks good and I‚Äôve accepted. This timing threads the needle nicely with standups and our other planning work.

I‚Äôll bring an outline of the engineering constraints and an updated view of what the team can take on before the Planning milestone. We can also use the session to sanity-check any assumptions that made it into MOB-100 and MOB-101.

Appreciate you syncing with everyone on the scheduling details.

Taylor",
          "date": "2025-11-03T12:23:17-05:00"
        },
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_planning_invite_alex_followup",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [
            "jordan.johnson@company.com",
            "sam.williams@company.com",
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Re: Invite: MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive (scope, risks, dependencies)",
          "body": "Thanks all for confirming.

Ahead of the session, could you each take a quick pass at the following so we can move quickly:

- Jordan: Note any high-risk areas in the current Mobile build that might impact the initial launch scope (especially around stability and integration points).
- Sam: Flag any performance or technical constraints that you think we should treat as hard requirements vs nice-to-have for the first release.
- Taylor: Bring a view of team capacity and any cross-team dependencies we‚Äôll need to line up before committing to dates.

I‚Äôll structure the agenda around these points and use MOB-100/MOB-101 as the backbone for the discussion.

See you all on the 11th.

Alex",
          "date": "2025-11-03T12:30:44-05:00"
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": "thread_mob_weekly_update_1",
      "subject": "Draft: Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7)",
      "messages": [
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_weekly_update_draft_initial",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Draft: Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7)",
          "body": "Taylor,

As discussed, I‚Äôm putting together this week‚Äôs Mobile App Launch update for the broader product and mobile leadership group and wanted to run the draft by you first.

My goal is to highlight the key wins without over-claiming where we‚Äôre still early. Based on the analytics export and the perf checks you and the team helped validate, here‚Äôs the current framing:

---
Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Wins (Nov 3‚Äì7)

1) Performance improvements
- We saw roughly a 15% improvement in p95 latency on the latest Mobile build (420ms ‚Üí 357ms). This lines up with the batching optimization Sam‚Äôs team rolled out mid-week and moves us closer to our target envelope for launch.

2) Early user traction
- Daily active users for the beta cohort increased ~10% week-over-week. Most of this appears to be organic growth, with a modest lift from a new in-product nudge we turned on. I‚Äôm planning to frame this as encouraging early traction rather than a result of any big campaign.

3) Planning alignment
- We‚Äôve scheduled a dedicated planning deep dive for next week to align on scope, risks, and dependencies ahead of the upcoming Planning milestone. The goal is to come out of that with a clear initial launch slice and an updated view of cross-team asks.

---

If anything feels mischaracterized (especially the performance numbers or how I‚Äôm describing the DAU bump), let me know and I‚Äôll tune the language before I send this to the VP and the mobile leads alias.

Alex",
          "date": "2025-11-07T16:02:48-05:00"
        },
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_weekly_update_taylor_feedback",
          "from": "taylor.brown@company.com",
          "to": [
            "alex.smith@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Re: Draft: Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7)",
          "body": "Alex,

Overall this reads well.

A couple of minor suggestions before you send it more broadly:

- Perf: The 15% call-out is accurate and worth highlighting, especially since it‚Äôs tied to a concrete change. Maybe add a short note that we‚Äôre monitoring for any regressions as usage scales, just so expectations stay grounded.
- DAU: I like the "encouraging early traction" framing. You might want to explicitly mention that we haven‚Äôt done any major campaigns yet, to reinforce that this is mostly organic.
- Planning: I‚Äôd soften the wording slightly to emphasize that we‚Äôre still pre-Planning milestone. Something like "We have a focused planning session scheduled for next week to align ahead of the upcoming Planning milestone" so it‚Äôs clear we‚Äôre not locked in yet.

With those tweaks, I‚Äôm comfortable with you sending it to VP Product and mobile_leads.

Taylor",
          "date": "2025-11-07T16:18:11-05:00"
        },
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_weekly_update_alex_ack",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Re: Draft: Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7)",
          "body": "Taylor,

Thanks for the quick read.

I‚Äôve incorporated your suggestions:
- Added a line under performance about monitoring for regressions as we scale.
- Clarified that we haven‚Äôt kicked off any major campaigns yet, so the DAU lift is primarily organic.
- Softened the planning language to make it clear we‚Äôre aligning ahead of the milestone rather than communicating anything as final.

I‚Äôll send the updated version to VP Product and mobile_leads now.

Alex",
          "date": "2025-11-07T16:27:54-05:00"
        },
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_weekly_update_final_send",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [
            "vp_product@company.com",
            "mobile_leads@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7)",
          "body": "Hi all,

Sharing a brief update on the Mobile App Launch for the week of Nov 3‚Äì7.

1) Performance
We saw an approximately 15% improvement in p95 latency on the latest Mobile build (from ~420ms down to ~357ms). This came from a batching optimization that Sam‚Äôs team rolled out mid-week and brings us closer to our launch target. We‚Äôre continuing to monitor the metrics as usage scales to ensure we don‚Äôt see any regressions.

2) Early user traction
Daily active users in the beta cohort grew about 10% week-over-week. Most of this appears to be organic growth, with a modest contribution from a new in-product nudge we enabled. We have not yet run any major campaigns, so we‚Äôre treating this as encouraging early traction rather than a campaign-driven spike.

3) Planning
We have a focused planning session scheduled for next week to align on scope, risks, and dependencies ahead of the upcoming Planning milestone for MOB. Coming out of that, we‚Äôll finalize the initial launch slice and update the roadmap and cross-team asks accordingly.

Best,
Alex
PM, Mobile App Launch",
          "date": "2025-11-07T16:32:27-05:00"
        },
        {
          "id": "msg_mob_weekly_update_vp_reply",
          "from": "vp_product@company.com",
          "to": [
            "alex.smith@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Re: Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7)",
          "body": "Alex,

Thanks for the clear summary.

The combination of the perf gains and early DAU lift is great to see, especially before we‚Äôve turned on any major marketing efforts. Please keep calling out where we‚Äôre seeing improvements tied to specific changes (like the batching optimization) ‚Äî that‚Äôs helpful context.

I‚Äôm also glad to hear you‚Äôve got a dedicated planning session on the books ahead of the milestone. Once you have outcomes from that discussion, I‚Äôd appreciate a brief follow-up with any material changes to scope or timing.

Best,
[VP Product Name]
VP, Product",
          "date": "2025-11-07T17:01:09-05:00"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
